intro: Heteropterys oberdanii, commonly known as the Ecuadorian beautyberry, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking clusters of violet-blue berries. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a distinctive reddish underside. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for various bird species.
